channel.title: CoD4 Server?
channel.description:
I was thinking that we could make like an MITB Server.
We can't make a dedicated server on 360, so i was thinking, if somone had a spare 360, with LIVE, that they could keep that running, for like, ever, and host private matches, joinable, for the players of MITB.
Comments ?

item.title: CoD4 Server?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Seeing as how my laptop pwns compared to my others and can run cod 4 at max settings, i’ve torrented it so i wana plaaaaaiiii

Thug-life:

More people on this site will have 360s as it has sold the most in Australia, canada and america and ironically most people on these forums are from them places, the ps3 has sold more in japan, china and europe than the 360.

l2irony

Read full topic

item.title: CoD4 Server?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

256mb of RAM probably isn’t enough to run it, or at least not enough to run it well.

(oh, and they probably don’t provide a PPC build of it, which you would have to have)

Read full topic

item.title: CoD4 Server?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

How about a compromise? Install linux on the PS3 and run the server on that. ;D

item.title: CoD4 Server?
item.dc:creator: @Full_Metalst Full Metalst
item.description:
@Full_Metalst wrote:

PeterMan:

CoD:WaW is better imo. Could be because I like the WW2 theme though.

Yeah, I like WW2 games too. I like the fact that COD4 has better multiplayer gameplay, but COD5 has bigger maps, and they’re more “spaced out”.

Read full topic

item.title: CoD4 Server?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If I was personally going to host a COD4 server (which I’m not, the game sucks and I’d rather host a BF1942 server…) it would definitely be on a computer, not a console.

item.title: CoD4 Server?
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

Last reply: “June 09, 2008, 06:43:31 pm”

If you’re wanting to invest in a CoD4 server for MITB, go ahead. I prefer CS:S, and cbf spending money on buying CoD4 for PC, as i think i’ll just get bored of it, after playing it for 10+ days on xbox, which led to me selling the game.

Read full topic

item.description:

No, don’t forget about it, you should get a call of duty 4 server for pc gamers like me.

search gameservers.com, thats where you can get em for about 20 dollars a month

item.title: CoD4 Server?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

True. But it will be a hell of a lot easier (and cheaper) to host it on a pc. I mean really, how many people on this site do you think don’t own a computer. 0…How many people that don’t own a 360 or ps3 (and yes, I have 1. Well actually both…)

item.title: CoD4 Server?
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“billygotshot, post:4, topic:207236”][quote author=Kaza link=topic=273157.msg2236164#msg2236164 date=1211421508]
I’m sure more people have a 360, although i don’t know…

If it was on 360, you could just buy just the console + wires, doesn’t need hardrive, or memory cards, and only needs a controller like every hour to change game type ?

PS3’s cost more (I think)
[/quote]

Actually someone did some math somewhere and if you added up everything from the ps3 and put it on the xbox including live for a year it ends up that xbox is like 80 bucks more or something.[/quote]Dont forget the cost of $100 for anybody (most people today) with Wi-Fi.

Read full topic
